p: Thus, in a research study, thymol oil was embedded in CS, a mucoadhesive polymer, processed in the form of hydrogels, and the investigations confirmed the advantages of the new compound for a biomedical application [ 100]. The in vitro results indicated biocompatibility when exposed to [3T3] fibroblasts and also that they have antimicrobial activity against Staphylococcus aureus and Streptococcus mutans for 72 h, and antioxidant activity for 24 h. The resulting data constitute desirable properties for a mucosal delivery system in antimicrobialâ€“antioxidant dual therapy for periodontal disease.
